contextId.information: In this parable Jotham describes the trees doing things that humans do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The trees once went out to anoint a king over them. For they said to the olive tree, 'Reign over us.'

contextId.information: In this parable, Jotham describes the trees as doing things that humans do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification|Personification]])
contextId.quote: the olive tree said to them ... fig tree said to them

contextId.information: In this parable, Jotham describes the trees and the vine as doing things that humans do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The trees said to the vine

contextId.information: In this parable, Jotham describes the thornbush and the trees as doing things that humans do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_parables]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: The thornbush said to the trees
